title: Hong Kong: 36 dead as fire engulfs high-rise buildings; over 250 people missing
content: A devastating fire in a Hong Kong housing estate has claimed at least 36 lives, with over 250 still missing.  Rescue efforts are ongoing amidst extensive damage to the high-rise complex.  President Xi Jinping has expressed condolences and urged swift action.  The blaze, which escalated rapidly, is under investigation as authorities work to account for all residents.

title: Siddaramaiah vs DKS: Rift, 'secret deal' and an admission - what's happening in Karnataka?
content: Karnataka's Congress faces a leadership tussle between Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar, with party chief Mallikarjun Kharge acknowledging the need for a resolution. Shivakumar hinted at a "secret deal" for leadership transition, while Siddaramaiah reportedly seeks a swift decision from the high command. Meanwhile, some leaders have proposed Kharge himself for the CM post.

title: New Japan vs angry China: Takaichi-Xi showdown - The PM China can’t intimidate
content: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's statement on collective self-defense regarding Taiwan has ignited a furious response from Beijing, including economic sanctions and diplomatic protests. This bold stance shatters Japan's strategic ambiguity, placing Tokyo directly in China's crosshairs. Takaichi, a nationalist figure, faces both domestic praise and international condemnation for her unapologetic remarks.

title: AI spending race: Mark Cuban warns Perplexity, OpenAI, Google; only one will win
content: Mark Cuban warns leading AI companies like OpenAI and Google are overspending in a race for the most powerful model, comparing it to the 1990s search engine boom. He cautions this intense competition could lead to a bubble, suggesting disruption will likely come from unexpected breakthroughs rather than incremental improvements.

title: 'We’ll continue to fight': Amid the storm, Test captain Shubman Gill backs Team India
content: Gill, recovering from a neck injury that forced him out of the match and the upcoming ODI series, addressed fans and teammates with a message of resolve on X. Gill had flown with the squad to Guwahati despite his injury, with team management initially hoping he might recover in time for a late fitness call.

title: Report: Pak using terrorism as state policy against India since 1947 - A chronology
content: A NatStrat report details Pakistan's use of terrorism as a state instrument against India since 1947, evolving through five distinct phases. The study highlights a consistent strategy by Pakistan's military and intelligence to deploy terrorism as part of its policy framework, despite India's resilience and evolving responses.

title: Google chips threaten Nvidia: Stock drops $250B; claims 'we lead industry'
content: Nvidia, the AI chip giant, publicly defended its market dominance after reports surfaced of Meta Platforms considering billions in spending on Google's competing AI chips. This news sent Nvidia's stock down significantly, while Alphabet shares rose. Google's Tensor Processing Units (TPUs) are emerging as a serious challenger, with Meta potentially renting them from Google Cloud.

title: Who’s performing at NFL Thanksgiving 2025? Halftime lineup revealed
content: The NFL’s 2025 Thanksgiving slate features three major halftime acts across three nationally televised games. Jack White headlines in Detroit, Post Malone takes the stage in Dallas, and Lil Jon closes the night in Baltimore. Here’s the full performer list, kickoff times, and where to watch each game and halftime show across FOX, CBS, NBC, and streaming platforms.

title: 'Went for morning walk ...': CJI flags toxic Delhi air; SC may shift to virtual hearings
content: Chief Justice of India Surya Kant is considering a shift to virtual-only Supreme Court proceedings due to Delhi's severe air pollution, after personally experiencing ill effects. The proposal, which may include options for senior lawyers to appear online, will be discussed with the Bar before any decision is made.

title: Gambhir Samasya: India's Test crisis deepens as South Africa humble hosts 2–0
content: Team India faces a crisis after a crushing defeat to South Africa, revealing deep issues in their Test setup under head coach Gautam Gambhir. A string of home losses and inconsistent performances have eroded India's once-dominant reputation, raising serious questions about direction and selection. This marks a turbulent period for Indian Test cricket.

title: Amazon to employees: No new third-party AI tools; pushes for house instead
content: Amazon has directed its software engineers to avoid using third-party AI coding tools like OpenAI's Codex and Anthropic's Claude Code, instead use its proprietary system, Kiro. This strategic move aims to bolster Amazon's competitive standing against rivals OpenAI and Google in the rapidly expanding AI code assistant market.

title: ‘Persistent, corrosive’: IMF blames corruption, elites for Pak’s economic crisis
content: Persistent corruption and "state capture" are crippling Pakistan's economy, the IMF warns.  A new report reveals dysfunctional institutions and elite privilege drain billions, hindering growth.  Addressing these deep-rooted issues is crucial for economic revival and restoring public trust, according to the assessment.

title: 14 off 139 balls: Sudarshan plays India’s 2nd-slowest innings ever — what’s the slowest?
content: India endured a crushing 408-run defeat in the second Test, handing South Africa their first series win in India in 25 years. This marked India's second home whitewash in 13 months, impacting their World Test Championship final hopes. Sai Sudharsan’s innings of 14 off 139 balls became the second-slowest Test innings by an Indian batter facing 100 or more balls.

title: Ayesha Curry shares heartfelt note for Stephen days after marriage controversy
content: Ayesha Curry posted a heartwarming message for her husband Stephen Curry's new book, "Shot Ready," amidst recent online backlash. She had previously expressed on a podcast that she didn't initially want marriage or children, leading to fan outrage and accusations of disrespecting her husband.

title: Charlie McAvoy faces heartbreaking week as wife Kiley shares family update
content: Boston Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy is going through a devastating week. As his wife Kiley McAvoy revealed an emotional family update on social media. With Charlie already recovering from recent jaw surgery. The couple is now facing additional personal challenges involving their young son.

title: Josh Jacobs injury update: Is Packers RB playing through bone bruise?
content: Josh Jacobs is pushing to return from a knee contusion and thigh bruise, and multiple reports say the Packers expect him to be available against the Lions on Thanksgiving. Matt LaFleur called Jacobs a game-time decision, but consecutive limited practices and national reporting point toward a Week 13 return unless Green Bay’s medical staff pulls him back late.

title: 'Indisputable reality': MEA on China's Arunachal claim; slams Indian woman's detention in Shanghai
content: India has strongly protested China's detention of an Indian citizen from Arunachal Pradesh at Shanghai airport, asserting the region's integral status. The Ministry of External Affairs stated that China's denials won't alter this reality, emphasizing the incident violated international norms and China's own transit regulations. Beijing, however, rejected harassment claims.

title: A multi-quadrillionaire! How one man accidentally became the richest man of all time
content: In July 2013, Pennsylvania resident Chris Reynolds opened his PayPal account and briefly found £70 quadrillion sitting there, instantly making him wealthier than Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos and any billionaire in history. The amount, the result of an error, vanished within minutes as PayPal corrected the glitch and apologised. Reynolds joked about paying off national debt and buying the Phillies before returning to reality.

title: Explained: How China gained rare earths dominance — and what it means for the US
content: China's decades-long dominance in rare earth elements, crucial for defense and technology, stems from extensive investment across the entire supply chain.  Recent export curbs have alarmed global manufacturers, prompting nations like the US to seek alternative sources and rebuild domestic production capabilities, highlighting significant geopolitical risks.

title: CWG 2030: PM Modi congratulates Nation as Ahmedabad gets hosting rights
content: "Delighted that India has won the bid to host the Centenary Commonwealth Games 2030! Congratulations to the people of India and the sporting ecosystem," PM Modi said in a post on X.

title: It's official! Ahmedabad to host 2030 CWG; gets final approval
content: Ahmedabad has been officially selected as the host city for the 2030 Commonwealth Games, securing the bid at the Commonwealth Sport's General Assembly in Glasgow. This marks a significant moment for India, as it will be the first time hosting the Games since New Delhi in 2010. The event will celebrate the centenary of the Commonwealth Games.

title: 'Growth remains robust': IMF backs India’s outlook; lauds contained inflation
content: India's economy is on a strong footing, according to the IMF, thanks to sound policies and structural reforms. Robust growth, well-managed inflation, and rising living standards are key highlights. The nation's resilience against global trade fluctuations, driven by its large domestic market, is also noted. Projections indicate continued strong economic expansion.

title: 'There is a Cisco': Why 'Big Short' investor Michael Burry is betting against Nvidia and Palantir
content: Michael Burry, famous for his housing market bet, is now shorting AI giants Nvidia and Palantir. He criticizes their accounting practices, particularly how cloud companies extend chip depreciation, inflating current earnings. Burry warns this AI boom mirrors the dot-com bubble, with Nvidia at its center, potentially leading to significant financial overstatements.

title: 4 health problems you can detect through your eyelashes
content: Your eyelashes offer vital protection and can signal underlying health issues like nutritional deficiencies, hormonal imbalances, autoimmune conditions, or eyelid infections. Observing changes in lash thickness, length, or strength can help detect problems early. Maintaining good eyelid hygiene and a balanced diet supports lash health and overall well-being.

title: Trump's pardons, Ozempic, and cheaper turkey: Unpacking Thanskgiving 2025
content: But this year, the performance feels different. The pardon stands on one end of the cultural table, loud and ceremonial, while the rest of Thanksgiving sits on the other end, quieter and lighter than before. Turkeys are cheaper, appetites are shrinking, and the national feast is no longer quite the binge it once was. Somehow, everything around the ritual has changed, and the ritual itself has stayed exactly the same — which might be the most American thing about it.

title: 'Country with stained record of bigotry': India rejects Pak's Ram Temple remark
content: India has strongly rejected Pakistan's objections to Prime Minister Modi's participation in the Ram temple ceremony in Ayodhya. The Ministry of External Affairs called Islamabad's remarks politically motivated and unacceptable, stating Pakistan has no standing on India's internal affairs and accusing them of habitual interference.

title: K'taka CM row: Sidda wants high command to decide soon; min confirms push citing DKS' ambition
content: Karnataka minister Satish Jarkiholi revealed Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has urged the Congress high command for a swift decision on leadership change. Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has consistently expressed his ambition for the chief minister's role. Jarkiholi plans to discuss the matter with Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge.

title: Canada trims 2026 study-permit quota, extends exemptions for graduate-level applicants
content: Canada’s new international student cap marks a decisive shift in its immigration and education framework, sharply reducing study-permit volumes and expanding exemptions for graduate applicants. While the policy aims to curb temporary-resident growth and ease pressure on housing and infrastructure, it also tightens competition for seats, reshapes institutional finances, and alters global student mobility trends.

title: ‘IIT-Bombay as IIT-Mumbai’: Fadnavis to write to PM Modi; move after MNS criticism
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis will write to the Prime Minister and Union Education Ministry to officially rename IIT-Bombay to IIT-Mumbai. This follows criticism from the MNS over Union Minister Jitendra Singh's remarks suggesting the institute should retain its original name. The state government considers the renaming demand legitimate.

title: Where is Imran Khan? Rumours over ex-Pak PM take over social media; sisters assaulted
content: Speculation surrounds Imran Khan's fate after his sisters were allegedly assaulted by police while seeking a meeting. Social media claims he was killed in Adiala Jail, where he has been held since August 2023. His sisters reported a "brutal and orchestrated assault" by Punjab police during a peaceful protest outside the jail.

title: Why coach Gambhir, chief selector Agarkar are answerable for home debacles
content: Indian cricket faces a crisis after recent home Test series losses. Coach Gautam Gambhir is under pressure amid team's poor performance. Questions arise about planning and player selection. The team's fortress has collapsed, leading to a need for strategic changes. This situation demands attention and a clear path forward for Indian cricket.

title: How to flatter Trump 101: US envoy gave lesson to Russia on peace deal; call exposes coaching
content: A US envoy reportedly advised Russia's top foreign policy adviser on how President Putin should pitch a peace plan to then-President Trump. The plan, discussed with Trump's team, aimed to leverage Trump's perceived role as a "man of peace" following a Gaza deal. The White House described the approach as "standard negotiating procedure."

title: Delhi Capitals co-owner pushes for 'specialist red ball coach' after series loss
content: India men's cricket team head coach Gautam Gambhir stated that the BCCI will decide his future following the 2-0 Test series whitewash against South Africa. Gambhir acknowledged the team's recent performance but also highlighted previous successes, including results in England, the Champions Trophy, and the Asia Cup.

title: Singer DELAROSA shot dead at 22 in ambush-style attack in LA; fans pay tribute
content: Rising Latin artist DELAROSA, 22, was tragically shot and killed in a violent ambush in Northridge, Los Angeles, over the weekend. The singer was in a parked car when assailants opened fire. Despite being rushed to the hospital, she was pronounced dead on arrival.

title: Massive fire engulfs multiple high rises in Hong Kong; at least 4 dead - video
content: A devastating fire ripped through multiple high-rise towers at Wang Fuk Court in Hong Kong's Tai Po district, claiming at least four lives and trapping several others. Firefighters battled thick smoke billowing from the 31-storey residential blocks, which house approximately 2,000 apartments, as two residents remained in critical condition with burn injuries.

title: Riley Gaines slams ruling as Jammie Booker tops Andrea Thompson at WSW
content: Controversy erupted after Jammie Booker won the World's Strongest Woman competition, with many questioning her gender identity. Riley Gaines publicly criticized Booker's win, sharing a meme and supporting claims that Andrea Thompson was the rightful winner. Gaines has consistently advocated for fairness in women's sports, previously clashing with Simone Biles over trans athletes.

title: 'No, genuinely no’: Ex-CJI Gavai says never faced pressure from political leadership
content: Ex Chief Justice of India BR Gavai stated he faced no executive pressure and defended the Collegium system's transparency. He cautioned against judicial overreach, emphasizing courts must act within constitutional limits, especially when addressing "bulldozer justice" and collective punishment.

title: Harmer hammer for India: SA spinner surpasses Dale Steyn; breaks multiple records
content: South Africa achieved a historic Test series triumph in India, winning the second Test by a massive 408 runs. This marked India's largest-ever defeat by runs and South Africa's first series win on Indian soil in 25 years. Off-spinner Simon Harmer was instrumental, taking 17 wickets and becoming South Africa's leading wicket-taker in India.

title: MLB execs predict the offseason: Where will top free agent pitchers land? Does Tucker get $400 million?
content: We surveyed the sport on the biggest free agents and top trade candidates as baseball's hot stove heats up.

title: Chiefs RG Smith among trio ruled out vs. Cowboys
content: The Chiefs ruled out three key contributors in right guard Trey Smith, tight end Noah Gray and cornerback Chris Roland-Wallace ahead of their Thanksgiving Day matchup against the Cowboys.

title: Falcons top WR London doubtful to play vs. Jets
content: Falcons wide receiver Drake London is doubtful to play Sunday against the Jets because of his knee injury, coach Raheem Morris said Wednesday.

title: NCAA pitches shorter transfer windows for hoops
content: The Division I Men's and Women's Basketball Oversight committees have proposed that the notification-of-transfer windows open for 15 days following the conclusion of the men's and women's NCAA tournaments.

title: Luka calls out slippery court after win over Clips
content: Luka Doncic had 43 points and fell one rebound shy of a triple-double but complained about the court conditions for the NBA Cup win over the Clippers.

title: Okla. juco hoops player dies from game injury
content: Ethan Dietz, a sophomore basketball player at Connors State College in Oklahoma, died Tuesday from an injury suffered during a game Saturday in Texas.

title: NFL special football to honor U.S. 250th birthday
content: The NFL will commemorate the United States' 250th birthday with specially embossed footballs and field markings.

title: What we’re hearing entering Week 13: State of the Bucs, George Pickens’ future, fantasy intel
content: Are the Buccaneers worried about their losing streak? Will the Cowboys extend George Pickens? Here's the latest intel, plus fantasy football advice.

title: How a legendary historian is quietly fueling OKC's championship rise
content: As OKC GM Sam Presti formed a Thunder team built for a dynasty, he was inspired by a man who has been working on the same project for more than 50 years.

title: Fantastic finishes from the biggest games of Rivalry Week
content: The most memorable endings from Ohio State-Michigan, Alabama-Auburn, Clemson-South Carolina and more.

title: Week 14 preview: Rivalry Week stakes, plus conference championship scenarios
content: Ahead of Rivalry Week, our college football experts get into the stakes in the biggest matchups of Week 14.

title: How a Dak Prescott initiative saved a Cowboys exec with Stage 2 cancer
content: Dallas QB Dak Prescott and the senior VP of communications look back on their friendship through a fortified bond: "It's bigger than football."

title: The search for one of the ugliest rivalry trophies in college sports: King Spud
content: Is King Spud lost forever? The trophy's vanishing act is one of the stranger mysteries in college sports.

title: Women's Power Rankings: Top 5 holds as Michigan rises, three new teams join
content: The Wolverines make a big jump and Iowa, Kentucky and Vanderbilt crack the top 16 heading into a big weekend.

title: Men's Bracketology: Purdue stays No. 1 overall, but the top four get a shake-up
content: The headlines might not be screaming about them, but we're noticing the Blue Devils' 1-seed-worthy résumé.

title: WWE Survivor Series preview: Can the WarGames teams coexist?
content: Greg Wyshynski breaks down the biggest storylines at Survivor Series: WarGames, including John Cena's final PLE match.

title: The Thanksgiving Panic Index: Which NHL teams are the most concerned?
content: Teams in playoff position on the holiday tend to stay there (77.1% since 2005). Who is in the best and worst shape?

title: Matchup rankings: Upgrade Mark Andrews, downgrade Javonte Williams
content: The most and least favorable matchups in the NFL for this week's games at the four key fantasy positions: QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: WNBA CBA negotiations: Why players say league's latest proposal is 'slap in the face'
content: The Nov. 30 WNBA deadline is looming for a new CBA. The two sides continue to meet during the holiday week.

title: Over the river and through the parlays: Thanksgiving is a sports betting holiday too
content: With big games and marquee teams on the menu, Thanksgiving week is among busiest of the year for sportsbooks.

title: Teen star Estevao has Chelsea looking like a team that deserves 'world champions' tag
content: After a win like this in the Champions League over Barcelona, led by teen star Estevao, maybe Chelsea are the real deal after all.

title: Man City's squad issues were made apparent in loss to Leverkusen
content: Despite a rotated lineup, Manchester City's reserves did not showcase their talents and were left exposed.

title: Why is Bill Belichick doing this? A journey to the bottom of the ACC with an NFL legend
content: A season in, the legendary NFL coach's head-scratching decision to helm a lowly ACC team continues to confound.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus Thanksgiving game memories
content: Let's update our NFL Power Rankings ahead of Week 13. We also picked out Thanksgiving memories for 31 teams that have played on the holiday (sorry, Jaguars).

title: Solak: Should Browns stick with Sanders? Could Colts lose AFC South?
content: Sizing up Shedeur Sanders' first start, the three-team race in AFC South, George Pickens' next contract, more.

title: Pound-for-pound rankings: Haney in, Canelo out, Benavidez moves up
content: Where do Devin Haney, David Benavidez and Jesse Rodriguez land after dominant victories? Here are the latest ESPN P4P rankings.

title: Fantasy fast break: Eric Moody on Mikal Bridges' durability, Kel'el Ware's rise and more
content: Eric Moody's fantasy basketball insights you need to know about, including Mikal Bridges' durability and production in New York, Kel'el Ware's second-year rise and more.

title: Offseason questions for every NWSL team: A way-too-early look at 2026
content: The NWSL season is over, and the planning for 2026 begins immediately. Here is one burning question for each team.

title: How San Diego went from expansion afterthought to cup contender
content: Little was expected of San Diego in its debut year, but this risk-taking young side is one step from MLS Cup.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool 'dream' of signing Bayern Munich's Olise
content: Bayern Munich star Michael Olise would be a "dream" signing for Liverpool. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Taiwan Announces $40 Billion Defence Budget Amid China's Invasion Threats
content: Taiwan's President Lai Ching-te on Wednesday announced a special $40 billion budget for arms purchases, including to build an air defense system with high-level detection and interception capabilities called Taiwan Dome.

title: Bloodstained Bodies Of Man, Woman Found Inside Car In Tripura
content: Blood-stained bodies of a young man and a young woman were discovered inside a Hyundai car near the Holokhet Rail Bridge area in Udaipur town in Tripura's Gomati district on Wednesday.

title: "Kyun Nahi Bolenge?" Mamata Banerjee Slams Rajya Sabha's Slogan Guidelines
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday expressed strong views on the Rajya Sabha bulletin's guidelines on slogans in Parliament, emphasising the significance of "Jai Hind" and "Vande Mataram" as national slogans.

title: 'Will Cancel Bail': Judge To Trinamool Leader After Court No-Show
content: A special CBI judge on Wednesday warned former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee that his bail in the primary teachers recruitment corruption case would be cancelled after he did not appear in person for the hearing in the court.

title: 'We Support All Efforts To Bring Lasting Peace': India On Ukraine Plan
content: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Wednesday said that India continues to back all efforts aimed at ending the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: Rate Cuts, Tax Breaks Could Lift Nifty 50 To 30,000 By 2026: JP Morgan
content: India's benchmark Nifty 50 index could climb to 30,000 by end-2026, implying an upside of about 15% from current levels, supported by steady fiscal and monetary policy that are expected to fuel demand, JP Morgan said on Wednesday.

title: IMF Forecasts 'Robust' 6.6% Growth For India Despite Headwinds, US Tariffs
content: Despite external headwinds, India's economic growth rate in FY26 is expected to remain robust, supported by favourable domestic conditions, according to an IMF report released on Wednesday.

title: Delhi Congress Leaders Hold Press Conference Wearing Oxygen Masks
content: Delhi Congress leaders held a press conference on Wednesday wearing masks and carrying oxygen cylinders to highlight the plummeting air quality in the national capital and demanded that the ruling BJP bring the city out of this "health emergency".

title: Italy Makes Femicide A Crime Punishable By Life Imprisonment
content: Italian lawmakers on Tuesday unanimously backed a bill making femicide -- the intentional killing of women or girls -- a specific crime punishable by life imprisonment.

title: Kolkata Law College Rape Survivor's Father Threatened To Withdraw Case
content: The father of the survivor in the Kasba Law College gangrape case has lodged a police complaint alleging that unidentified men on a two-wheeler threatened him and asked him to withdraw the case.

title: 36 Dead, 279 Missing After Fire Ravages 7 High-Rise Buildings In Hong Kong
content: A fire spread across seven high-rise apartment buildings in a Hong Kong housing complex, killing 13 people and leaving others still trapped, the city's fire services said Wednesday.

title: Delhi Air Quality Remains 'Very Poor' For 13th Consecutive Day
content: Delhi's air quality remained in the "very poor" category for the 13th consecutive day on Wednesday, with the city recording an AQI of 327 and forecasts indicating no relief in the coming week.

title: US Immigration Officials Detain Woman Related To White House Press Secretary
content: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) has detained the mother of White House press secretary Karoline Leavitt's nephew, who is also facing deportation to Brazil.

title: Delhis 'Historic' 53 Km Yamuna Cycle Corridor Project Makes Headway
content: Delhi has moved forward with its 53-km Yamuna cycle corridor, a project aimed at promoting green mobility, easing traffic, and supporting the city's environmental revival.

title: "I'm A Congressman By Birth": DK Shivakumar Amid Karnataka Crisis
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar on Wednesday asserted that the party is united and focused on the 2028 assembly and 2029 Lok Sabha elections.

title: Man Poses As IAS, IPS Officers For 2 Years To Dupe People, Arrested
content: Police in Hyderabad have arrested a high-profile white-collar offender, Bathini Shashikanth, for allegedly impersonating senior government officials to cheat and extort money from unsuspecting citizens.

title: Top Court Sets Up Medical Board To Explore Passive Euthanasia For UP Man
content: The Supreme Court on Thursday asked the Noida district hospital to constitute a primary board to explore passive euthanasia for a 31-year-old man suffering from 100 per cent disability quadriplegia and has been in vegetative state for over a decade.

title: "Should Be Solved Soon": Karnataka Minister To NDTV Amid Leadership Tussle
content: Satish Jarkiholi, Karnataka minister and Siddaramaiah loyalist, told NDTV today that he hoped that the row over the Chief Minister post - one that his boss Siddaramaiah described as "confusion" - be resolved soon.

title: "It Is Being Examined": India On Bangladesh's Sheikh Hasina Extradition Request
content: India said that it has received Bangladesh's request to extradite former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and is now examining it as a part of ongoing judicial and internal legal processes.

title: "Upbringing Guided My Response": Ex Chief Justice On Shoe-Throwing Incident
content: Former Chief Justice of India BR Gavai opened up on the shoe-throwing attempt made at him during court proceedings, saying that his reaction, to not pursue action against the lawyer, stemmed from his upbringing and personal values.

title: Karnataka RTC unions meet CM, seek release of arrears and pay revision
content: Following the meeting, Anantha Subba Rao, president of the KSRTC Staff and Workers’ Federation, said the discussion with the Chief Minister lasted nearly an hour and was “positive and constructive”.

title: Madras High Court commends T.N. govt for implementing its orders to prevent women harassment at workplaces
content: Justice R.N. Manjula says, it is the need of the hour for the Centre too to take similar proactive steps

title: Karnataka HC orders official of Central govt. to inspect jaggery factory that was closed allegedly due to influence of State Minister who owns sugar factory
content: The High Court of Karnataka, noting allegations that a private jaggery factory’s closure was influenced by a current Cabinet Minister who is also a director in a private sugary factory, restrained officials of the State government in interfering in the affairs of the jaggery factory till further orders.

title: Assam tea planters’ body sets conditions to part with land for labourers
content: The Consultative Committee of Planters’ Associations seeks relief from providing welfare facilities and adequate compensation for land to be acquired once the Assam Fixation of Ceiling on Land Holdings (Amendment) Bill, 2025, is enacted

title: Most Kochi city campuses untouched by election fever
content: While the local body elections have not caused any ripples on campuses, a few students are clear about their own politics

title: Saving Himalayas is as important as saving borders, says veteran BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi
content: He was criticising the Char Dham all-weather road project and the reckless construction of roads in the hills; Defence Ministry has previously said double-laned roads are needed to meet border security concerns in the hills

title: Studying Bangladesh’s plea for Sheikh Hasina’s extradition: India
content: “We remain committed to the best interests of people of Bangladesh, including peace, democracy and stability in that country,” Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said

title: ED facilitates restitution of assets to applicant
content: The Supreme Court restored a deposit to Lodha Developers Ltd. under the provisions of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, an official of the agency said

title: Arbitrary actions by China ‘most unhelpful’ to ties: MEA
content: The spokesman emphasised that Arunachal Pradesh is an ‘integral and inalienable part of India and this is a fact that is self evident’

title: Maharashtra to push for renaming IIT Bombay to IIT Mumbai, says CM Fadnavis
content: The development comes amid row over Minister Jitendra Singh’s recent remarks; MNS’s Raj Thackeray warns of a bid to erase Marathi identity

title: Cabinet approves Phase 2 of Pune Metro Rail project
content: Under this phase, Line 4 (Kharadi–Hadapsar–Swargate–Khadakwasla) and Line 4A (Nal Stop–Warje–Manik Baug) would be completed

title: Canara Bank to raise ₹3,500 crore through ATI Bonds to strengthen its capital base
content: Sunil Kumar Chugh has been appointed as bank’s new Executive Director with effect from November 24, 2025, for a period of 3 years

title: India rejects Pakistan’s remarks on Ram Temple flag raising with “contempt”
content: MEA counters Pakistan’s “deep concern” over Ayodhya Ram Temple flag, cites record of bigotry and human rights violations

title: Right to trade of online gaming platforms can’t be at the cost of human lives, government tells Supreme Court
content: Affidavit says money sourced through these activities is laundered or used as funding for terror, besides being a reason for increasing addiction and fatalities among young users

title: Supreme Court committee recommends phased creation of Goa Tiger Reserve
content: Panel proposes that 468.6 sq. km. area, which contains 102 households, be notified as core and buffer areas of the reserve in the first phase; another 208 sq. km. with 612 households, may be considered later

title: Should a person from neighbouring country be allowed to use Aadhaar to become a voter: Supreme Court asks petitioners
content: Justice Joymalya Bagchi observes that the inherent jurisdiction of ECI to “examine, vet, verify” documents submitted to it is traceable to Section 21 of Representation of the People Act and Article 326, which requires a voter to be a citizen

title: Mumbai marks 26/11 anniversary as leaders reiterate zero tolerance for terror
content: Tributes paid to victims and security personnel; President, PM and Home Minister call for united fight against terrorism

title: CJI pushes for a national judicial policy on Constitution Day
content: The CJI said a uniform judicial policy would encourage coherence across jurisdictions and bring more clarity and consistency in the decisions of the various constitutional courts on seminal questions of law

title: Four killed as speeding truck hits road roller in Gujarat
content: Contract workers and an engineer died on the Udaipur–Ahmedabad highway after a truck rammed into repair machinery; driver booked for negligent and rash driving

title: HC orders Calicut University to convene Senate meeting in 30 days
content: A Bench of Justice V.G. Arun issued the directive on a petition filed by the State government, challenging notifications issued by the Governor, in his capacity as Chancellor, on the appointment of a new V-C for the varsity

title: Don’t resort to suicide, Mamata urges BLOs
content: CM’s appeal comes after two booth level officers in West Bengal died by suicide during the ongoing SIR process

title: Prosecute officials who grant illegal building plan permissions in hill stations, orders Madras High Court
content: A Division Bench of Justices S.M. Subramaniam and Mohammed Shaffiq reverses an order passed by a single judge, who had permitted construction of a building within 17 metres from reserve forests

title: Leadership issue will be resolved after discussions with Sonia Gandhi and Rahul: Congress chief Kharge
content: D.K. Shivakumar appeared to be offering olive branch to leaders aligned with Siddaramaiah, meeting many including Satish Jarkiholi

title: BJP promises blueprint for development of local bodies in Kerala
content: A report card will be presented to the people every year to outline development works already undertaken and those in the pipeline, says Rajeev Chandrasekhar

title: No clinical establishment must deny life-saving aid to patients needing emergency care, says Kerala HC
content: Hospital authorities ought to also ensure that, along with the discharge summary, all investigation reports pertaining to the treatment too have to be handed over to enable patient to maintain proper records, says Division Bench of the High Court

title: Property tax revision drive marred by claims of  extortion by GHMC staff
content: Confusion over notices, lack of awareness among some residents about their rights have made them vulnerable even as official data shows sharp rise in revised tax assessments across thousands of properties

title: UDF hopes to continue its winning streak as LDF sees a silver lining in Palarivattom
content: LDF says Congress rebel Joseph Alex’s entry as an Independent will work in its favour, while the UDF maintains that his presence will barely affect its vote bank in the division; BJP is promising solutions to drug and mosquito menace

title: ‘Rewarding separatists, torturing patriots’ has stopped in J&K: Manoj Sinha
content: ‘J&K is now moving ahead, guided by the ideals of equity, social, and economic justice as enshrined in the Constitution by Babasaheb Ambedkar,’ the J&K Lieutenant Governor said at a Constitution Day event

title: Delhi HC seeks Centre’s response on U.K. academic Nitasha Kaul’s plea against entry ban
content: Ms. Kaul, who has written about Kashmir, Hindutva and nationalism, was deported while trying to enter India in February 2024, and had her OCI status revoked for “anti-India activities” in May 2025

title: CPI(M) stages protest in Amaravati, seeks Parliament law on capital status
content: The party presses the Centre to commit funds for Amaravati, take responsibility for institutional borrowings and address bank lending issues, warning of intensified protests if there is no response

title: KSCA elections: Karnataka High Court directs to produce video recording of scrutiny of nomination papers
content: K.N. Shanth Kumar, contesting for president’s post, has questioned rejection of his nomination paper

title: Reorganised districts to guide Census and future delimitation in Andhra Pradesh
content: With the State set to expand to 29 districts, the new administrative boundaries will be used for next year’s Census and shape the redrawing of constituencies after 2026

title: President to be chief guest at Navy Day celebrations on Dec. 3 at Shangumugham
content: As a prelude to the December 3 Navy Day celebrations and Operational Demo, the Naval Band performed at the Nishagandhi Auditorium in Thiruvananthapuram on Wednesday

title: Belandur Road–Carmelaram double line gets CRS nod; Huskur station approved for passenger use
content: K-RIDE officials have said the CRS team carried out a detailed examination of the track, signalling systems, and station infrastructure before granting clearance

title: NHRC notice to railways on serving of ‘only halal-processed meat’ on trains
content: The complainant has alleged that Hindu and Sikh passengers do not get food options that match their religious beliefs, affecting their freedom of choice and religious rights

title: Naidu pushes AP-Link revamp, sets year-long deadline for pothole-free roads
content: Chief Minister directs officials to strengthen the new logistics corporation, speed up road works, enforce quality control, and improve monitoring with technologies like drones and LiDAR

title: Rights panel tells govt. to disburse travel aid to HIV patients
content: The Commission issued the directive after an HIV patient from Malappuram complained that travelling to Thrissur to collect medicines was difficult without financial support

title: Housing schemes emerge as a key concern in door-to-door campaigns in Kozhikode
content: Most grievances centred on unfinished or delayed housing projects, as rural voters conveyed their frustration to visiting candidates

title: Insurance aid handed over to Chorode hit-and-run victim
content: Motor Accident Claims Tribunal had earlier issued an order for the immediate settlement of the compensation claim finding it as a crucial lifeline for the ongoing intensive medical care for the injured girl

title: 1,416 foreigners deported since 2021, Assam Assembly told
content: A total of 32,207 people were identified as foreigners staying illegally in the State between January 2021 and October 2025, Assam Accord Implementation Minister Atul Bora said

title: Andhra Pradesh BJP chief accuses Congress and Nehru family of undermining Constitution
content: At a Constitution Day event in Vijayawada, Madhav alleges that Congress humiliated Ambedkar and weakened his ideals, contrasting this with the Modi government’s efforts to uphold constitutional values

title: Betting lines for every top-25 team in college football
content: the Ohio State Buckeyes and Michigan Wolverines face off as AP top-15 opponents . a week left in the regular season, Dinich joins this Morning to break down the playoff chances . it will be the 36th time that the AP could reshape the CFP bracket .

title: 🎥 Action! Ranking top sports movies since 2000
content: a seton hall sports poll surveyed 1,519 adults in the past quarter century . one title stood out as the defining sports movie of this century, according to a poll . "the blind side" was the sports movie Americans reached for most, edging out another .

title: Week 14 Anger Index: Why BYU, Notre Dame and others should be mad
content: Ohio State stays atop the latest CFP rankings, with Indiana, Texas A&M, Georgia and Texas Tech all remaining in their same spots in the top five . a botched extra point at the end of Notre Dame-Texas a&M still hinges on the college football playoff rankings . the canes had a 90% chance of winning, according to ESPN's metrics .

title: Previewing the Thanksgiving three-pack: Picks, predictions, fantasy X factors
content: the average over/under point total of 51.2 is the highest for Thanksgiving games over the past 40 seasons . ESPN Research provides optimistic stats for all six teams, along with betting nuggets to know . three analysts give us final score picks for the three games .

title: Bills sign veteran WR Cooks, release WR Moore
content: the Buffalo Bills have added another veteran wide receiver, Brandin Cooks . Cooks was waived by the new Orleans saints on Saturday and cleared waivers Monday . the bills have elevated wide receiver Gabe Davis from the practice squad .

title: Bottom 10: The Lane Train seems to have gone off track
content: Paul Finebaum explains why it feels like Lane Kiffin will be picking a new job instead of staying at Ole miss . Rusty: "you think we need one more." "Ocean's Eleven" reminds you of Thanksgiving dinner and the laughs shared around the table .

title: NBA Power Rankings: Raptors, Pistons battle for top of East standings
content: we're about one month into the 2025-26 NBA regular season and coming to the end of group play for the third-annual NBA Cup this week . the Detroit Pistons continue to be dominant through the first couple of weeks of play, climbing to the top of the Eastern Conference and 2.5 games ahead of the Toronto Raptors . our insiders break down this week's NBA power rankings .

title: CFP Bubble Watch after Tuesday's ranking: Who needs a win during Rivalry Week?
content: the ACC's hope of having two teams qualify for the 12-team field is still alive . five ACC teams are still ranked above no. 24 Tulane, the only representative from a group of 5 conference . a gap remains in spite of the head-to-head win .

content: the 2025-26 season has reached its quarter mark, with all 32 teams having played more than 20 games . a first-quarter letter grade for all 32 clubs is through the games of Nov. 23 . they lead the NHL in goals per game while also giving up the fewest goals .

title: The cost of ‘teaching lessons’: How punishment culture is pushing students over the edge
content: student suicides rose from just over eight thousand a decade ago to nearly fourteen thousand in 2023, an increase far steeper than population growth . behind the numbers are classrooms shaped by competition, families weighed down by expectations and schools where discipline often blurs into public shame . the death of a class 10 student in Delhi has now placed renewed scrutiny on whether certai .

title: Amid health scrutiny, Trump insists never felt better, never worked harder
content: "there will be a day when I run low on Energy, it happens to everyone," he says . he blames "creeps" and "radical left lunatics" for the report . the 79-year-old is now the oldest president in u.s. history .

title: Hong Kong fire: Xi urges to 'make every effort' to fight blaze; top developments
